# 1. CRAN Submission: Overview

CRAN is the **Comprehensive R Archive Network** â€” the main repository for R packages.

Submitting to CRAN means:

::: incremental
-   âœ… Your package is publicly available
-   ğŸ§ª It passes strict quality checks
-   ğŸŒ It becomes accessible via `install.packages("yourpkg")`
:::

# 2. Requirements Before Submission

Make sure your package:

::: incremental
-   Passes `R CMD check` with **no ERRORs**, **no WARNINGs**, and **no (avoidable) NOTEs**
-   Has proper documentation for all exported functions
-   Has a valid `LICENSE`
-   Uses a CRAN-acceptable package name
-   Has examples that run in \< 5 seconds
:::

. . .

Run:

``` r
devtools::check()
```

# 3. Handling NOTEs and WARNINGs

Some NOTEs are common (e.g., missing author ORCID), butâ€¦

::: {.fragment .fade-up}
> â— Never submit to CRAN with unaddressed **ERRORs** or **WARNINGs**
:::

. . .

To reduce NOTEs:

::: incremental
-   Add your ORCID via `Authors@R`
-   Ensure `Title` and `Description` are plain text
-   Avoid using `cat()` or `print()` in package code unless essential
:::

# 4. Simulate a CRAN Check ğŸ§ª

Use `rhub` to simulate CRAN checks on different platforms:

``` r
rhub::check_for_cran()
```

Or test specific platforms:

. . .

``` r
rhub::check(platform = "windows-x86_64-release")
```

. . .

âœ… This helps catch issues that only appear on Windows or macOS.

# 5. Submit to CRAN

Use the `devtools` helper:

``` r
devtools::release()
```

This will:

::: incremental
-   Check your package one final time
-   Ask you to confirm
-   Open the CRAN web form in your browser
-   Help generate an email to CRAN maintainers
:::

## ğŸ“¬ What Happens After Submission?

::: incremental
-   Youâ€™ll get an automated confirmation email
-   Within \~24â€“72 hours, a CRAN maintainer will review your package
::: 

. . .

-   They may:
    -   Accept it immediately âœ…
    -   Request fixes or clarifications âœï¸
    -   Reject with detailed reasons âŒ

## ğŸ”„ Updating a CRAN Package

To submit an update:

::: incremental
-   Bump the version (e.g., from 1.0.0 â†’ 1.0.1)
-   Add a clear `NEWS.md` entry
-   Ensure compatibility with current R version and dependencies
-   Follow the same submission process
:::

::: {.fragment .fade-up}
ğŸ“Œ You can only submit **once every 1â€“2 weeks** (per package).
:::

## ğŸ“¦ Installing Git

## ğŸ§­ Connect GitHub to R (Create PAT)
